entry.title: REVTEX
entry.content:
1 Downloads
revtex.zip revtex4-2-tds.zip

sudo unzip revtex4-2-tds.zip -d /usr/local/share/texmf/

sudo mktexlsr /usr/local/share/texmf/
ls  /usr/local/share/texmf/
bibtex  doc  ls-R  source  tex

2 check two useful pdf file

evince /usr/local/share/texmf/doc/latex/revtex/auguide/auguide4-2.pdf
evince /usr/local/share/texmf/doc/latex/revtex/aps/apsguide4-2.pdf

first is overall glance, second is aps local

3 aps local

ls /usr/local/share/texmf/doc/latex/revtex/sample/aps/
apssamp.bib  apssamp.pdf  apssamp.tex  apstemplate.tex  fig_1.eps  fig_2.eps  vid_1a.eps  vid_1b.eps

apstemplate.tex use [preprint] for manualscript with single column
apssamp.tex use [reprint] for submit with two column

evince /usr/local/share/texmf/doc/latex/revtex/sample/aps/apssamp.pdf

this is a collection, a well developmented model

entry.title: My commentaries on PR papers
entry.content:
Recently, I start to read papers about condensed matter physics. I find that Physical Review B is celebrating its 50th anniversary in 2020.As part of the celebration, in 2020 they are presenting a Milestone collection of papers that have made lasting contributions to condensed matter physics.
What a pleasant coincidence! I think how about I write down my commentary while reading. This will be a fun journey.

1 Theory of polarization of crystalline solids
R. D. King-Smith and David Vanderbilt
Phys. Rev. B 47, 1651 (1993)

2 Efficient iterative schemes for ab initio total-energy calculations using a
plane-wave basis set
G. Kresse and J. FurthmÃ¼ller
Phys. Rev. B 54, 11169 (1996)

3 First-principles study of spontaneous polarization in multiferroic BiFeO3
J. B. Neaton, C. Ederer, U. V. Waghmare, N. A. Spaldin, and K. M. Rabe
Phys. Rev. B 71, 014113 (2005)

4 Topological insulators with inversion symmetry
Liang Fu and C. L. Kane
Phys. Rev. B 76, 045302 (2007)
